Dialogue.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogue.Text: The other T-Rex fighting for Diana's heart may have had strength and size on their side, but you figure that your small size and speed came in handy at Skyline Paradise. Those mountains are so hard to navigate, especially at such a high altitude, but the flowers you found up there really paid off. You haven't even left Homer's cave when Diana happens to wander in, and immediately brightens.

Dialogue.Speaker: Diana
Dialogue.Text: Hey Phil! I was just here to visit Homer. He told me you'd gone out again - you've been awfully busy lately! Were you out finding this new flower? It's beautiful! I really need to go and find some water to keep these alive. It's too bad so much of it's dried up around here now!

Dialgoue.Speaker: Homer
Dialgoue.Text: Homer hear there still some water out by Optimism Island. Though, maybe not many optimisms anymore. Homer not go there cause lots of mean dinos, but maybe Phil can look!

Dialogue.Speaker: Diana
Dialogue.Text: Oh, Optimism Island! That used to be a great place to go swimming. Have you ever been, Phil?

Dialogue.Speaker: Phil
Dialogue.Text: 1) What am I, a Megaladon? 2) I'm not a big swimmer, but I'd give it a try!

Dialogue.Speaker: Diana
Dialogue.Text: If you say so... I'd still be careful.

Dialogue.Speaker: Diana
Dialogue.Text: Haha, if it weren't all dried out I'd go with you!
